member.name: T:GameArchives.IFSNode
member.summary: Represent an element of a filesystem, usually directories and files.

member.summary: The name of this node.

member.name: P:GameArchives.IFSNode.Parent
member.summary: The folder where this node resides. For the root directory, this is null.

member.summary: Represents a single file in a filesystem.

member.summary: The size of this file.

member.summary: Indicates whether this file is compressed in the archive.

member.summary: The size of this file, as it is in the archive.

member.name: P:GameArchives.IFile.ExtendedInfo
member.summary: A collection of extended information about the file. The values in the collection depend on the type of package the file is from. Modifying this dictionary results in undefined behavior.

member.summary: Get a byte-array in memory containing all the data of this file.

member.summary: Gets a stream that allows access to this file.

member.name: M:GameArchives.IFile.GetStream
member.summary: Get a stream (either memory-backed or disk-based) that allows access to this file.

member.name: T:GameArchives.IDirectory
member.summary: Represents a directory within some file system.

member.name: M:GameArchives.IDirectory.TryGetFile(System.String,GameArchives.IFile@)
member.summary: Tries to get the named file. If it is not found, returns false.

member.name: M:GameArchives.IDirectory.GetFile(System.String)
member.summary: Get the file in this directory with the given name. Throws exception if not found.
member.exception: Thrown when the file could not be found.

member.summary: Tries to get the named directory. If it is not found, returns false.

member.name: M:GameArchives.IDirectory.GetDirectory(System.String)
member.summary: Get the directory in this directory with the given name. Throws exception if not found.
member.exception: Thrown when the directory could not be found.

member.name: M:GameArchives.IDirectory.GetFileAtPath(System.String)
member.summary: Tries to get the file at the given path, which is relative to this directory.
member.exception: Thrown when a directory in the path could not be found.
Thrown when the file could not be found.

member.name: P:GameArchives.IDirectory.Files
member.summary: A collection of all files in this directory.

member.name: P:GameArchives.IDirectory.Dirs

member.summary: The root directory of this filesystem.

member.summary: Indicates whether this package can be modified.

member.summary: The name of the root directory. Never used in paths, though.

member.summary: The .NET type of the file objects in this package.

member.returns: The file at the given path.

member.summary: Returns a list containing all the logical files of the specified type in this archive.

member.summary: Replace the given target file with the given source file. This modifies the archive file permanently!

member.name: T:GameArchives.PackageReader
member.summary: Collection of methods for reading packages.

member.name: M:GameArchives.PackageReader.ReadPackageFromFile(System.String)
member.summary: Attempts to read the file as a supported archive package. If the file is not of a supported format, throws an exception.
member.exception: Thrown when an unsupported file type is given.

member.name: M:GameArchives.PackageReader.ReadPackageFromFile(GameArchives.IFile,System.Func{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Attempts to read the file as a supported archive package. If the file is not of a supported format, throws an exception.
member.param: An IFile referring to the archive package.
This callback will be called when a package is a likely match but needs a password/decryption key. It will be called with a request string, and should return the key.
member.returns: The package, if it could be opened.
member.exception: Thrown when an unsupported file type is given.

member.name: M:GameArchives.PackageReader.ReadPackageFromFile(GameArchives.IFile,System.String)
member.summary: Reads a package using the given decryption key if necessary.

member.name: M:GameArchives.PackageReader.ReadPackageFromStream(System.IO.Stream,System.String)
member.summary: Tries to read a package given only a stream. This makes a dummy file which works with the package reader.
member.param: Stream to read from. This must support the Length property.
(Optional) the filename to give the dummy file.

member.summary: A list of supported file formats and their extensions, presented in a format that an OpenFileDialog supports.
